name: ENERGY STAR Air Source HP CC v. 6.0 (FS)

market_entry_year_source.notes: Standard goes into effect in 2023, but assume equipment is already on the market that meets the spec.

source_data.title: ENERGY STAR Program Requirements Product Specification for Central Air Conditioner and Heat Pump Equipment Version 6.0

energy_efficiency_source.notes: Split system (see Table 3: Energy-Efficiency Criteria for Certified Residential Cold Climate Heat Pumps); using SEER despite ENERGY STAR switching to SEER2 in 2023; conversion from original standard: COP = SEER / 3.412 (see EIA source).

source_data.title: ENERGY STAR Program Requirements Product Specification for Central Air Conditioner and Heat Pump Equipment Version 6.0
Residential Demand Module of the National Energy Modeling System: Model Documentation 2014

installed_cost_source.notes: Total ENERGY STAR installed cost in 2017

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies

product_lifetime_source.notes: Median of average ENERGY STAR lifetime in 2017

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies

market_scaling_fractions_source.heating: Applies to all residential fuel-fired heating; no electric heating is switched by this ECM

cooling.title: RECS 2015 Microdata
cooling.fraction_derivation: Cooling multiple of 59.5% was determined as a proportion of total homes with a ducted cooling system where heating is done using any non-electric heating energy source. Total homes with ducted cooling in the sample is 76,090,522, and then filtered for homes with fuel-fired heating system (45,241,958).

_description: Standard size residential air source heat pump for cold climates that meets the ENERGY STAR performance specification in 2023
